opening.mentorIntro: How you communicate — both the channel and your tone — can shape how the client sees you. Choose wisely.

options.label: Good Email (empathetic + professional)
options.learnerText: Hi Jamie, I understand your concerns about pricing and delivery. Let’s discuss how we can address these points so you’re confident moving forward.
options.clientResponse: Thanks for the thoughtful reply. I do want to talk this through in more detail. Can we set up a quick video call?
options.mentorFeedback: Strong move. You acknowledged the concern and kept the door open for conversation. This sets a constructive tone.

options.label: Curt Email (short, transactional)
options.learnerText: Jamie, pricing and delivery are as quoted. Let me know if you want to discuss further.
options.clientResponse: I think we do need to talk — I have major concerns. Can we set up a call?
options.mentorFeedback: Direct, but it risks sounding dismissive. With sensitive clients, warmth and empathy go a long way.

options.label: Reassuring Text
options.learnerText: Hi Jamie — I saw your note. Let’s talk about your concerns and find the best solution.
options.clientResponse: Thanks — let’s set up a video call later today.
options.mentorFeedback: Nice job. Even in a short format, you conveyed openness and flexibility.

options.label: Call Request Text
options.learnerText: Hi Jamie — I saw your concerns. Can you jump on a video call now?
options.mentorFeedback: This is efficient, but be careful not to rush. Some clients need a bit of transition before diving into a call.

videoImmediate.title: Video Call (immediate)
videoImmediate.clientLine: Hey there, I appreciate you jumping right in. I’m concerned about how the delays and pricing changes will affect our launch.

options.label: Partnering response
options.learnerLine: Let’s review your priorities together and see what adjustments we can make.
options.mentorFeedback: Excellent. You’re framing it as a partnership.

options.label: Rigid response
options.learnerLine: Our terms are set, but I can walk you through them.

transition.managerLine: You’ve set the tone with your initial communication. After discussing the challenges Jamie and ACME are facing, your video call wraps up with the following…

positive.clientVideoText: Thanks for taking the time to talk this through. I feel much better about moving forward.
positive.mentorFeedback: This is great news! You kept a warm, professional tone and adapted to the client’s needs. Great job!

negative.clientVideoText: I understand your position, but I’m still concerned. Let’s pause and revisit this next week.
negative.mentorFeedback: Not the best outcome. Your initial tone made it harder to build rapport. Think about how to connect before moving into problem-solving.

wrapUp.managerLine: As a sales professional, you’re the face of our company and set the tone for every client interaction. How you communicate — both your choice of channel and the tone you use — can shape client perception and determine whether we close a deal. Be warm, be professional, and be ready to adapt to your client’s needs. Thanks for taking a few minutes to sharpen your sales skills and help make ACME a success.
